intro: Peucedanum kingii var. alpina, commonly known as alpine cow parsley, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbel-like flower clusters. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its leaves are finely divided and often have a mild, spicy scent, while its white flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators in high-altitude environments.
